availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Perry, Jr. (Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Gess Perry. Father of William Perry, Mary Perry, John Perry, and George Perry. Farmer in Jessamine County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1850. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 1, p. 8B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p.105.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 305A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994042, Jessamine County Deaths.
"John Perry (1818-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 97958883, accessed June 16, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/97958883.
